monitr 0.0.0.9000
  • Functions and data

monitr

The goal of monitr is to provide some useful functions to optimize the computation of the exposure period of the policyholders in a life insurance policies portfolio(optimize_exposure()), to compute the associated expected claims(compute_expectedclaim()) and the IBNR claims(calculate_IBNR()). The package also include simulated data about a life insurance policies portfolio. It is strongly recommended to read the documentation of each function, since it is required a specific structure of the dataset containing the policy to let the functions work properly. In this specific context, monitr provides two function (expand_portfolio() and duplicate_portfolio()) to make the datasets suitable for the functions usage.

Example

An optimal usage of the functions provided is the following:

library(monitr)
data(lifepolicies)

lifepolicies %>%
  optimize_exposure(.polnr = Policy_id, .inceptiondate = Inception_date,
                    .termdate = Term_date, .claimdate = Claim_date,
                    .lapsedate = Lapse_date, .birthdate = Birth_date,
                    .gender = Gender) %>%
  compute_expectedclaim(.table = SI2006, .age = AGE,
                        .gender = GENDER, .qx = qx) %>%
  calculate_IBNR(.ibnrtable = IBNR_factors_CQP,
                 .ibnrfactor = IBNR_factor, .cy = CY)
